citeinfo.origin: University of Tokyo, Ocean Research Institute
citeinfo.title: Fish Mitochondrial Genome Database (MitoFish)

abstract.p: MitoFish is a fish mitochondrial genome database, allowing the user to know data availability of complete nucleotide sequence of mitochondrial genome of fishes. If you have nucleotide sequence data from fish mitochondrial genome, MitoFish also allows you to conduct homology search of the nucleotide sequence against the fish complete mitochondrial genome database.
There are currently a total of 230 records in the MitoFIsh database containing complete mitochondrial genome only in fish and fish-like vertebrates.
The taxonomic classification system for MitoFish is mainly based on NCBI taxonomy. MitoFish database is based on GenBank and RefSeq (organelle genome resources.)
Citation: Nishida, M. Editor. 2005. "MitoFish: Fish mitochondrial genome database". Version 1.09. World Wide Web electronic publication. http://mitofish.ori.u-tokyo.ac.jp

descript.purpose: To provide fish mitochonrial genome to the public.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
